title: Science and Technology for Society (STS) Forum - 2018
decision_details:
- The 'Science and Technology for Society (STS) Forum Sri Lanka' was first held in the year 2016 with the objective of achieving the benefits from the progress in the fields of science, technology and research in the developed world and  increasing the contribution of the knowledge on science, technology and research to the national development process and it has been possible to initiate the support of the Sri Lankan Scientists residing in foreign countries, towards the local science and technology projects. 

	Taking into consideration the success of its first forum, it has been proposed to conduct the same for the second time with the participation of approximately 1,000 persons including the representatives of other countries and international organizations working in collaboration with Sri Lanka in this field, eminent Sri Lankan expatriate scientists, Government and Private sector technologists, innovators and university and school students. Identification of emerging technologies enabling economic development, science and technology innovations for Sustainable Development Goals are the themes scheduled to be addressed at the forum. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Susil Premajayantha, the Minister of Science, Technology and Research, to conduct the 'Science and Technology for Society (STS) Forum Sri Lanka' in Colombo, in October 2018 for the second time, was approved by the Cabinet.
